description: APPLICATION FOR ADVERTISEMENT CONSENT FOR THE DISPLAY OF 1X INTERNALLY ILLUMINATED FASCIA SIGN.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Sign Supplier Sheet dated 15/05/24; Front elevation; Location Plan; Site Plan and Photographs
Condition : 2 - Permission Expires (Advert Consent) - This consent shall expire 5 years from the date of this decision.
Condition : 3 - Owner's Permission - No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

Condition : 4 - Clean and Tidy Condition - Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity of the site.

Condition : 5 - Removal if Necessary - Where an Advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.

Condition : 6 - (Hours of darkness) The proposed advertising illumination levels must not exceed 300cd/m2 during the hours of darkness and the intensity of the illuminance must be in conformity with the limit set out in the Institute of Lighting Professionals (ILP) publication: "The Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements" (PLG05, January 2015).

Reason: Reason: To preserve safety on the highway and to comply with Policy DM D5 (Advertisements) of the Merton Adopted Sites and Policies Plan (July 2014) and Regulation 14 of the Town & Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) Regulations 2007.

Condition : 7 - (Daylight illuminance levels) For lighting during the day, either no lighting, or maximum lighting levels (such as for digital displays) are set in accord with night time maximums (300cd/m2), or controlled so they comply with the guidance approach to ambient lighting as setout within "The Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements including digital displays" (PLG05/23, 2023).

Reason: To preserve safety on the highway and to comply with Policy DM D5 (Advertisements) of the Merton Adopted Sites and Policies Plan (July 2014) and Regulation 14 of the Town & Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) Regulations 2007.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
